messages.subject: how history changes
messages.msgSnippet: Who first circumnavigated the world? Turns out what they taught us in school wasn t right. (Sorry if anyone here is shocked by that.) History s alive and
messages.messageBody:
Who first circumnavigated the world?
Turns out what they taught us in school wasn't right.

(Sorry if anyone here is shocked by that.)

History's alive and changing!

http://news3.xinhuanet.com/english/2004-07/08/content_1583224.htm

Very fun, and good to know!

If you like this sort of thing, subscribe to explorator@yahoogroups.com

It's usually archeology, but sometimes this kind of history.
It's like the current events of history. <g>
The archeology links are wonderful.

From their yahoopage:

EXPLORATOR is a free weekly newletter representing the fruits of the labours
of 'media research division' of The Atrium. Various on-line news and magazine
sources are scoured on a daily basis for news of the ancient world (broadly
construed: practically anything relating to archaeology or history prior to
about 1700 or so is fair game) and they are delivered to your mailbox free of
charge every Sunday morning!

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Explorator/

to subscribe directly:

Explorator-subscribe@yahoogroups.com
